meanings.definition: The quality or state of being supercilious.
meanings.sent1: Her superciliousness was evident in the way she looked down on others.
meanings.sent2: His superciliousness made it difficult for others to approach him.
meanings.sent3: Despite her superciliousness, she couldn't hide her excitement when she won the competition.
meanings.sent4: The superciliousness of the cat as it walked by seemed to mock the other animals.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's superciliousness towards the students created a tense atmosphere in the classroom.

meanings.definition: Behavior or attitude of displaying haughty disdain.
meanings.sent1: The superciliousness in her tone made it clear she thought she was better than everyone else.
meanings.sent2: His superciliousness towards the waiter was uncalled for.
meanings.sent3: Despite his superciliousness, he couldn't help but admire the talent of the street performer.
meanings.sent4: The superciliousness of the queen towards her subjects was well-known throughout the kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The politician's superciliousness during the debate turned off many voters.

meanings.sent1: His superciliousness towards his colleagues alienated them from working together.
meanings.sent2: The superciliousness of the celebrity made the fans feel unappreciated.
meanings.sent3: Despite his superciliousness, he secretly admired the dedication of his rival.
meanings.sent4: The superciliousness of the rich businessman was evident in the way he treated his employees.
meanings.sent5: The coach's superciliousness towards the players affected team morale negatively.
